page.title: 11Stafford Common (contd).
page.content: grazed.In 1876 it was stated that out of 2,300 ratepayers entitled to exercise Common rights,only 130 did so. In 1864 the first of several military reviews was held on the Common and by the 1870s it was frequently used for fetes,cricket matches and other entertainments.There was a small golf course in the early 20th century.In 1976 the Common was 200a.in area,with farmers paying for grazing horses between May and October. The general management of the pastures was in the hands of the borough council and the borough court leet,but by the later 16th century the details were the responsibility of the six men,who were still appointed by the leet in 1747.
